column1: Project: prj__7239 - For the supply and delivery of 25 Complete Portable Wireless CCTV units/2,Contract,"London Borough Of Hillingdon",Awarded,2017-03-28T07:49:00Z,"Supply and delivery of 25 Complete Portable Wireless CCTV units","RE-ADVERTISEMENT
The Council of London Borough of Hillingdon wishes to purchase 25 x wireless portable CCTV units as a flexible alternative to installing fixed CCTV cameras and poles.

The cameras should be suitable to collect evidence to support the police and/or local authority enforcement in response to resident concerns about crime and anti-social behaviour including fly-tipping in the area. .
The equipment must be of a suitable build quality that allows for deployment flexibly for up to 12 weeks at a time.
The cameras should be suitable for temporary fixture to existing street light columns and be able to be connected to existing power supply within the column.

The cameras should have 30 day recording capability within the unit, and the capability for images to be viewed and downloaded remotely on a standard computer (the ""viewing platform"") using the software supplied by the supplier, using wireless transmission. The range would be within the London Borough of Hillingdon.

****The full tender opportunity is advertised on www.capitalesourcing.com.****",,,London,"35121000 ","Allison Mayo",amayo2@hillingon.gov.uk,"Civic Centre, High Street",,Uxbridge,"UB8 1UW",England,01895556354,,,,,01/11/2016,31/10/2019,14/10/2016,YES,"Project: prj__7239 - For the supply and delivery of 25 Complete Portable Wireless CCTV units",No,No,No,Products,100000,,01/12/2016,105000,"[Wireless CCTV Ltd

column1: COV - 8611 - AWARD,Contract,"Coventry - Solihull - Warwickshire",Awarded,2020-02-25T10:38:11Z,"COV -  Supply of  surveillance cameras - AWARD","Coventry City Council's Environmental Services are seeking to procure a contract to purchase surveillance cameras for 'policing' fly tipping in some City of Coventry streets. The intention is to run a pilot in six streets within the City which forms the contracts initial requirement. Each of the streets will require 2 cameras so a total of 12 in all. The cameras will require a software solution to be supplied that allows Environmental Services to download data from the cameras (the cameras would need to be capable of storing 30 days of data, which is overwritten by new data on a 30-day cycle) and remotely rotate the cameras to focus on different parts of the street as necessary. Please see the Invitation To Tender (ITT) document for further information on the required specification of the cameras and software.

The awarded contract will remain open for  the supply of the ongoing software and any further call off of the surveillance cameras during the term of the agreement.",,"CV1 2GN","West Midlands","32234000 ","Michael Duffy",michael.duffy@coventry.gov.uk,Coventry,Coventry,Coventry,"CV1 2GN","United Kingdom","024 7697 1414",,,,,02/03/2020,01/03/2024,21/01/2020,NO,,Yes,No,No,Products,0,240000,25/02/2020,0,"[Wireless CCTV Ltd
column2: Charles Babbage House,, Kingsway Business Park, Rochdale, Greater Manchester, United Kingdom, OL16 4NW

column1: CN1002008,Contract,"EMSCU Nottinghamshire Police",Awarded,2019-03-04T14:12:38Z,"Body Worn Video Devices, DEAMS (Digital Evidence and Asset Management Software) and Ancillary Products, Services and Solutions - Lot. 3 Integrated BWV Devices and DEAMS Solution","EMSCU has undertaken a compliant EU tender exercise under the Restricted Procedure of the Public Contract Regulations (2015) to establish a national DPS Framework agreement for Body Worn Video Devices, DEAMS (Digital Evidence and Asset Management Software) and Ancillary Products, Services and Solutions for a period of 4 years +1 +1 from the 14.1.2019.

The contractors are providing a service through which other contracting bodies can access data which is specified within the specification, this is an indication of the broad specification for services that OCB's may require over the lifetime of the Contract. The Provision of Body Worn Video Devices, DEAMS (Digital Evidence and Asset Management Software) and ancillary products, services and solutions is an indicative outline of our requirements and not exhaustive of the provision of data and capability required.",,,"Any region","32000000 ","Elly Grayston",elly.grayston@emscu.pnn.police.uk,"Nottinghamshire Police Headquarters",,Nottingham,NG58PP,England,07595011965,,,,,29/01/2019,28/01/2026,16/12/2018,NO,,Yes,No,No,Products,18000000,,28/01/2019,1,"[Audax Global Solutions Ltd
